**Major League Cricket 2024 Season**

* The Domestic Supplementary Draft took place on June 18, finalizing the rosters for the upcoming second season, which is set to commence on July 5.
* Three domestic players were selected: Chaitanya Bishnoi (LA Knight Riders), Aaron Jones (Seattle Orcas), and Sunny Patel (MI New York).
* The selected players bring a range of skills, including batting, spin bowling, and leg spin, to their respective teams.
* The second season of MLC will feature a thrilling opening match between MI New York and Seattle Orcas on July 5, followed by a match between Texas Super Kings and LA Knight Riders.
* Tickets for the tournament are now available, with general admission tickets starting at $30 per person.

**Partnership Announcement**: Luxury automotive brand Lexus has become the Automotive Partner for the MLC's second season.

**Season Details**: The second season of MLC is set to kick off on Friday, July 5.

**Season Activities**: The tournament will feature entertainment, fireworks, free giveaways, player signings and meet-and-greets, merchandise giveaways, food trucks, and samples throughout the season.

**Partnership Benefits**: As part of the partnership, Lexus will be integrated into on-field and broadcast content, fan communications, and MLC digital platforms. This is the first partnership between Lexus and MLC.

**Announcement:** Lexus has been announced as the Automotive Partner for the second season of Cognizant Major League Cricket (MLC).

**Partnership Details:** As part of the partnership, Lexus will be featured prominently in on-field and broadcast content, fan communications, and MLC's digital platforms.

**Tournament Details:** The second season of MLC begins on July 5, with tickets available online, starting at $30 per person. The tournament will feature world-class cricket matches, entertainment, fireworks, free giveaways, player signings, and more.

**About MLC:** MLC is the first professional Twenty20 cricket championship in the United States, sanctioned by USA Cricket, featuring six teams: Los Angeles Knight Riders, MI New York, San Francisco Unicorns, Seattle Orcas, Texas Super Kings, and Washington Freedom.

**Partnership Announcement**: Cognizant Major League Cricket (MLC) has partnered with luxury car brand Lexus for its second season, integrating Lexus into on-field, broadcast content, fan communications, and digital platforms.

**Season Details**: The second season of MLC begins on Friday, July 5th. Tickets for all matches, including playoffs, are available online, with general admission tickets starting at $30 per person.

**Season Highlights**: The season promises to be exciting, with entertainment, fireworks, free giveaways, player signings, meet-and-greets, merchandise giveaways, food trucks, and samples throughout the tournament.

**League Background**: MLC is the first professional Twenty20 cricket championship in the United States, sanctioned by USA Cricket, featuring six teams: Los Angeles Knight Riders, MI New York, San Francisco Unicorns, Seattle Orcas, Texas Super Kings, and Washington Freedom.

* Major League Cricket (MLC) has announced a sponsorship deal with Lexus, making the brand its automotive partner for the second season.
* The deal includes Lexus being featured in broadcast and on-field content, fan communications, and MLC digital media throughout the season.
* This is one of several partnerships announced by MLC, including collaborations with Remitly, Cognizant, Royal, and Stake.
* The second season of MLC is set to begin on July 5, with tickets available online starting at $30 per person, featuring world-class competitions and additional entertainment such as fireworks, giveaways, athlete signings, and more.

Glenn Maxwell, an Australian cricketer, has joined the Washington Freedom team in the Major League Cricket (MLC) tournament. He will be joined by fellow Australian teammates Travis Head and Steve Smith, as well as former IPL coach Ricky Ponting. Other confirmed signings for the second season of MLC include Adam Zampa, Spencer Johnson, Tim David, Matt Short, and Jake Fraser-McGurk.
